eu.ubitech.futuretpm

Class SupportUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.ubitech.futuretpm.SupportUtils

  • public class SupportUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    The SupportUtils class is containing various methods to check if the device supports NFC authentication. Specifically, we are going to check if the following conditions are met:
    • The device is running Android 6.0 or higher
    • The device supports NFC
    • The device's NFC is enabled
    • The user has granted your app permission to access the NFC sensor.
    This class includes methods: {isSdkVersionSupported(), isPermissionGranted(Context), isNFCEnabled(Context), isNFCSupported(Context)}
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gina Chatzimarkaki [gina.chatzimarkaki@gmail.com]

    • Method Detail

      • isSdkVersionSupported

        public static boolean isSdkVersionSupported()
        This method will check:

        Condition I: Check if the android version in device is greater than Marshmallow, since NFC authentication is only supported from Android 6.0 and to support the google plays second factor authentication window.

        Note: If your project's minSdkVersion is 23 or higher, then you won't need to perform this check. Its implementation is in class: SupportUtils. Type is public. The type or member can be called by any object.
        Returns:
        The return type is boolean true if supports it or false otherwise
        See Also:
        SupportUtils

      • isNFCSupported

        public static boolean isNFCSupported(android.content.Context context)
        This method will check:

        Condition II: This method will check if NFC is supportable on user's device. Its implementation is in class: SupportUtils. Type is public. The type or member can be called by any object.

        Returns:
        The return type is boolean true if NFC is supportable on user's device or else returns false
        See Also:
        SupportUtils

      • isNFCEnabled

        public static boolean isNFCEnabled(android.content.Context context)
        This method will check:

        Condition III: This method will check if NFC is enable on the device. Its implementation is in class: SupportUtils. Type is public. The type or member can be called by any object.

        Returns:
        The return type is boolean true if NFC is enable on the device or false otherwise
        See Also:
        SupportUtils

      • isPermissionGranted

        public static boolean isPermissionGranted(android.content.Context context)
        This method will check:

        Condition IV: Check if the permission has been added to the app. This permission will be granted as soon as the user installs the app on their device. Its implementation is in class: SupportUtils. Type is public. The type or member can be called by any object.

        Returns:
        The return type is boolean true if permission is granted or false otherwise
        See Also:
        SupportUtils
